name: HeatPumpType
title: Heat Pump Type
description: Heat Pump Type codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: A centralized heat pump system that distributes conditioned air through ductwork to multiple rooms or zones in a building.
A ductless heat pump system with one outdoor unit connected to a single indoor unit, ideal for heating and cooling individual rooms or small spaces.
A ductless heat pump system with one outdoor unit connected to multiple indoor units, allowing independent temperature control for different zones.
A ground-source heat pump system that circulates fluid through a sealed underground loop to exchange heat with the earth.
A ground-source heat pump system that draws water from a well or surface water source, extracts heat, and discharges the water.
A ground-source heat pump system where refrigerant circulates directly through underground copper coils without an intermediate heat transfer fluid.
A heat pump system that distributes heating or cooling through water-filled pipes to radiators, baseboard heaters, or radiant floor systems.
A heat pump system that extracts heat from outdoor air for heating and releases heat to outdoor air for cooling.

designation.value: Bomba de Calor de Fuente de Aire

concept.definition: A heat pump system that uses water from a lake, pond, or cooling tower as the heat source or heat sink.

designation.value: Bomba de Calor de Fuente de Agua

concept.definition: A heat pump system that uses a heat-driven absorption cycle rather than mechanical compression, typically powered by natural gas or solar energy.
